message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it focuses on the application of neural probabilistic language models in bilingual NLP, specifically Statistical Machine Translation. Additionally, the paper proposes a joint space model of ngram-HMM language model to facilitate the application to various tasks, which is a common research area in cs.CL. 

The paper also involves the use of non-parametric Bayesian construction, which is a common research area in cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Furthermore, the paper discusses the potential of NPLM to complement potentially 'huge' monolingual resources into the 'resource-constraint' bilingual resources, which is a common research area in cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper also involves the use of system combination in the area of SMT, which is a common research area in cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). 

Finally, the paper discusses the treatment of noise in NPLM, which is a common research area in cs.SD (Sound).
